result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Charles Stacy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daniel C. Stacy in court with attorney Anne Renc. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 15CF403 and 15CM261.

3:34 p.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF403:
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - No contest
Count 3 - No contest 

15CM261:
Count 1 - No contest 
Count 2 - DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Counts 2 & 3 on 15CF403 and Count 1 is DRI and guilty on Count 1 of 15CM261 and Count 2 is DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Renc makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Defendant makes a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
15CF403:
Count 1 - DRI

Count 2 -
Impose/Stay a 9 month jail sentence concurrent to Count 3 but consecutive to any other sentence being served
*15 days jail credit 
**Jail sentence can be transferred to Wood County or Jackson County 
Placed on probation for 24 months
***Conditions of Probation:
*AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
*Maintain absolute sobriety 
*Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment; do not go upon premises where alcohol is sold other than incidentally to the public
*Maintain full-time employment.
*Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
*Write a letter of apology to the victim, J.L.J., and provide to agent
*Provide a DNA Sample if not already completed 
*Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  J.L.J. without prior approval of agent in writing
*Pay court costs and DNA Surcharge
*Cash bond to be applied to the costs
*Probation can be transferred to Wood County or Jackson County if accepted, depending on where is employment ends up being

Count 3 -
Impose/Stay a 9 month jail sentence concurrent to Count 2 but consecutive to any other sentence being served
*Jail sentence can be transferred to Wood County or Jackson County 
Placed on probation for 24 months
*Probation can be transferred to Wood County or Jackson County 
*Comply with conditions in Count 2 

15CM261:
Count 1 -
Jail sentence of 90 days with 45 days in custody and 45 days on electronic home monitor 
*Jail sentence can be transferred to Wood County or Jackson County 
*1 day jail credit 
*Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
*Must report today for start date.
*Huber privileges are granted 
*Pay costs 


Count 2 - DRI

Following 15CF403.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Daniel Charles Stacy in court, in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
4:00 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Atty Knaapen makes statements.  Defendant has been unrepresented thru this case.  In August there was a pre-trial and he wished to proceed without counsel.  The defendant is in custody on new charges.  State does not feel it is appropriate to proceed in this case given the new charges.  The new case is set for 10/26/15 and asks that this file be adjourned and track with the new charge. 
Defendant concurs. 

BY THE COURT:  The proceedings in this case are to track with the new case.  

Defendant indicates he had contacted an attorney this morning.  Status conference scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Daniel Charles Stacy in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/Public Defender representation.
Defendant states he would like to represent himself. 
Court enters NO CONTEST plea on defendant's behalf.
2:38 p.m.  Court will recall this case to handle other matters. 

2:43 p.m.  Court recalls the case. 
Court questions the defendant re: Waiver of Counsel. 
BY THE COURT:  Court finds defendant is competent to represent himself. 

Court enters NOT GUILTY plea on defendants behalf. 

Court informs the defendant that he can ask for an attorney at any point and would refer him to the public defender for counsel if that happens. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  J. J. Unless the victim goes to CAP Services to get a Family Safety Plan and then files the form with the Clerk of Courts and District Attorney.  If filed, then no abusive contact with the above named.
Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center for all court dates.
Go to Public Defenders office.***11-04-15:   CAP Services: Personalized Family Safety Plan filed by: J.J.

ADA Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Knaapen states facts for anticipated charges of Battery, Criminal Damage to Property.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $2000 signature bond with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  6-29-15  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 1
